featured.text: They would carry their supplies in backpacks each weighing up to fifty pounds; it usually took at least 40 trips to get everything to the top and over the pass.
When an American lady wants to enter Taiwan for a one-week sight-seeing trip, one of the requirements is (A) to obtain a landing-visa at the CKS airport.
The brothers look forward to a family trip on a cruise.
He viewed the kidnapping as a wonderful camping trip.

other.text: I was worried about my first overseas trip, but my father ______ me that he would help plan the trip so that nothing would go wrong.
Having saved enough money, Joy two trips for this summer vacation, one to France and the other to Australia.
After hours of discussion, our class finally reached the _____ that we would go to Hualien for our graduation trip.
The transportation on the road was so difficult that few people could really enjoy the trip.
Therefore, a trip from New York to Los Angeles often causes fewer problems than a Los Angeles-New York trip. 49.
On his first trip to Europe, why did Camake think the audience might fall asleep? (A)
Over 100,000 people with “gold fever” made this trip hoping to become millionaires.
Most of our classmates are ________ taking a trip to Kenting National Park.
The original budget for my round-island trip was NT$5,000, but the ______ cost is likely to be 50 percent higher.

definition.zh_def: 旅行；一次出行或短途旅行。
definition.en_def: A journey or excursion, especially for pleasure.
definition.example: We plan to take a trip to the mountains this weekend.
